feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On Rivers Across The Southeast Interior This Week... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are near bankfull. This is due to high freezing levels causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. Periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior Sunday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Expected Wednesday And Wednesday Night... Snow is expected from after midnight tonight through Wednesday night. Little accumulation is expected as the snow should melt as it hits the ground.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Expected Wednesday And Wednesday Night... Snow is expected from after midnight tonight through Wednesday night. Less than one inch of accumulation is expected below 3000 feet. Above 3000 feet, between 2 and 5 inches of snow is expected, with the highest amounts above 5000 feet.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 12 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Central Interior. This includes the cities of Nenana, Tanana, Manley Hot Springs, and Old Minto.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:15PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat, Smoke, and Thunderstorms Chances Continue... * HEAT - An extended period of above normal temperatures is expected into this coming weekend, though not as hot as today. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 12 at 1:42PM PDT until July 12 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot, Dry, and Windy Conditions today and Wednesday Afternoon... .Abnormally hot conditions under the ridge has already created critically dry conditions east of the Cascades. As an upper level trough begins to displace the ridge currently over the area, winds during the afternoon will become gusty. This will result in critical conditions today and Wednesday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:41PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET... WICOMICO AND CENTRAL WORCESTER COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 1045 PM EDT... The storms which prompted the warning have weakened below severe limits, and no longer pose an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However, gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with these thunderstorms.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Winona, Houston and northwestern Vernon Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Houston, or 13 miles south of Winona, moving southeast at 45 mph.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 12 at 9:43PM CDT until July 13 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter to one half mile in dense fog. * WHERE...In Wisconsin, Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland and Iron Counties. In Minnesota, Southern Lake and Carlton and South St. Louis Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Red Cliff Band, the Bad River Reservation and the Fond du Lac Band.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:17PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dakota, northwestern Goodhue, southwestern Washington and southwestern Pierce Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 917 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rosemount, or 13 miles south of St. Paul, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wood and Portage Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Bevent to 6 miles west of Stevens Point to near Marshfield. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and brief heavy rain.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Few Strong Storms Possible This Evening... Scattered showers and storms will track southeast across the area this evening. A few could be strong with wind gusts to 40 mph, 1/2 inch hail and locally heavy rain. The storms look to push southeast of the area by 11 pm.
